p: High-performance liquid chromatography was performed to further demonstrate that unripe and ripe pods of T. chebula share the constituents of CHLA and CHLI ( Supplementary Figure S1), of which the dose–response effects against IAV replication were subsequently determined. As shown in Figures 2B,C, the IC 50 values against IAV replication of CHLA and CHLI were 1.36 ± 0.36 and 1.86 ± 0.98 μM, respectively, while the CC 50 values of both compounds were greater than 100 μM. These results show that CHLA and CHLI are potent anti-IAV inhibitors.
